body.p: If one or more of the chordae tendinae rupture, the person would be at risk of __________.

multiple_choice.choice: a clot forming in one of their coronary arteries

response.feedback: Incorrect. Clots in the coronary arteries form secondary to atherosclerotic plaque in those vessels, not ruptured chordae tendinae, which help hold some of the valve leaflets in place.
Incorrect. If chordae tendinae tear, there might be a decrease in cardiac output because of altered flow within the heart.
Incorrect. The aortic valve is not held in place by chordae tendinae.
Correct. If the chordae tendinae holding the mitral valve leaflets tear, there is likely to be backflow (regurgitation) through the valve during ventricular systole.
